docs.snippet: Monuments of figures revered by lower-caste Dalits have been damaged. The governing Bharatiya Janata Party denies that its supporters are to blame.

headline.print_headline: Political Tensions Boil Over in India as Vandals Take Jackhammers to Statues
headline.main: As India’s Tensions Boil, Even a Statue of Gandhi Isn’t Safe

docs.snippet: An India boxing team doctor was found by a Commonwealth Games Federation (CGF) Court to have breached the event's "No Needle Policy" by failing to store syringes properly in the run-up to the quadrennial showpiece in Australia.

headline.print_headline: Games: India Team Doctor Reprimanded for Needle Infringement
headline.main: Games: India Team Doctor Reprimanded for Needle Infringement

docs.snippet: Toyota Motor Corp and Suzuki Motor Corp agreed on Thursday to produce cars for each other in India as Toyota aims to increase its market share in the world's fifth-largest passenger car market.

headline.print_headline: Toyota, Suzuki to Produce Cars for Each Other in India
headline.main: Toyota, Suzuki to Produce Cars for Each Other in India

docs.snippet: India said on Tuesday it rejected a proposal from Google to roll out its Street View service, which shows panoramic images of roads and other sites.

headline.print_headline: India Rejects Rollout of Google's Street View Service
headline.main: India Rejects Rollout of Google's Street View Service

docs.snippet: The Mexico economy ministry said on Tuesday it has formally imposed anti-dumping duties on imports of carbon steel pipe from South Korea, Spain, India and the Ukraine after completing an investigation into "unfair" trade practices.

headline.print_headline: Mexico Slaps Tariffs on Steel Pipes From Korea, Spain, India, Ukraine
headline.main: Mexico Slaps Tariffs on Steel Pipes From Korea, Spain, India, Ukraine

docs.snippet: Vandini Sharma of Chandigarh, India, is the 16-year-old sister of Shubhankar Sharma, who makes his debut at the Masters this week. Her short stories have won literary awards. She has agreed to write a first-person account of her experience at the ...

headline.print_headline: The Masters Through the Eyes of a 16-Year-Old From India
headline.main: The Masters Through the Eyes of a 16-Year-Old From India

docs.snippet: Massive anti-India protests erupted in several parts of the Indian-controlled portion of Kashmir on Sunday amid fierce fighting between rebels and government forces that left at least 12 militants and three army soldiers dead, officials said.

headline.print_headline: Anti-India Protests Erupt in Kashmir Amid Deadly Fighting
headline.main: Anti-India Protests Erupt in Kashmir Amid Deadly Fighting

docs.snippet: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday ordered the withdrawal of rules punishing journalists held responsible for distributing "fake news", giving no reason for the change, less than 24 hours after the original announcement.

headline.print_headline: India Drops Plan to Punish Journalists for 'Fake News' Following Outcry
headline.main: India Drops Plan to Punish Journalists for 'Fake News' Following Outcry

docs.snippet: Ten people were killed and two were injured when a four-storey hotel collapsed in a crowded part of the central Indian city of Indore late on Saturday, a local police official said.

headline.print_headline: Hotel Collapse in Central India Kills 10, Two Injured
headline.main: Hotel Collapse in Central India Kills 10, Two Injured

docs.snippet: The Dalai Lama called on his people to remain united as the Tibetan community gathered on Saturday in a small hill town to mark 60 years of political asylum in India - although just one federal minister appeared at the event.

headline.print_headline: Dalai Lama Calls on Tibetans to Remain United as India Drifts Toward China
headline.main: Dalai Lama Calls on Tibetans to Remain United as India Drifts Toward China
